When you woke up you are...

You find that you are a girl and that you have a boyfriend with you.

You seem to be about 13 years old.

"Hey Jenna, are you ok?" asks a boy about your age.

"Y-Yeah, I'm fine" you manage to spit out.

"Oh good" the boy responds.

What do you do now?

11111.content:
"Sorry," you say "I know this is our first time out, but what is your name again. I totally blanked out."
"No problem Jenna," he says "My name is....
11111.title: Ask for the boys' name

choices: One of Jenna's friends walks in and starts gossiping with you
Go back outside to the pool
111111.content:
"Jared," you say, relieved that your gamble (guessing that this is your first date) paid off. "Sorry, Jared. I'm just totally spacing okay."

"That's okay!" Jared chirps. He laughs good-naturedly, scratching his blond, scruffy hair in a way you find curiously endearing. You would feel weird that an adolescent kid who looks like he's in seventh or eighth grade is trying to impress you by acting suave and striking curious poses, but that would only be if you ignored the equal weirdness of the fact that you are standing eye-to-eye with him, at least half a foot shorter than you used to be. Plus it's hard for you to judge while you're still taking in the young girl's body that you've ended up in, tan, slender and with only the faintest breast buds forming underneath the triangle-shaped pink bikini top.

"If you don't mind," you say, forcing yourself to smile. "I need to go to the bathroom right now."

"Sure, sure!' says Jared. "Go ahead. I hope you're all right." His tone and posture changes accordingly, going from jovial and lively to tense and concerned. You wave it off, affecting a painfully high giggle.

"Yes, I'm fine," you say. "Just give me a minute."

"Sure," he says, but you're already turned around before the word has left his mouth, walking as fast as you can with your short legs and tiny, bare feet. You almost walk into the men's restroom by mistake, but you course-correct at the last minute, saving yourself a world of embarrassment and awkwardness.

You're not even tantalized by the presence of other half-dressed woman, some high school classmates you've crushed on, others older and also drop-dead gorgeous. You beeline straight towards the mirror, and are disturbed when you find that your chest barely rises above the sink, and you have to lift your toes slightly to get a full look of yourself. You are an adolescent girl, all right, in middle school, it looks like, short, not yet in the deepest stages of puberty, with her brown hair, hazel eyes, and full lips, fairly indistinguishable from many other middle-school girls you've seen in your neighborhood.

"I'm a girl now," you think, "My name is Jenna, and I'm on a date with a boy name Jared. I'm going to need a little time to process this."
111111.title: Jared

choices: Just then, see your old body in the pool
Go to where Jared is and find your stuff in the adjacent chair (including phone)
1111112.content:
Even with the tired stereotype of girls spending forever in the bathroom, you're uncomfortable lingering too long among all these natural-born women lest they smell a rat and figure out who's actually looking out from behind Jenna's eyes. Trying to act as naturally as possible, you creep back out of the bathroom and to the swimming pool. The thought crosses your mind that you could give Jared the slip and hightail it out of there, but Jared spots you the moment you walk out of the bathroom, and is heading over like he's about to swoop you off your feet and hoist you on top of a white stallion.

"Hey Jenna!" he says. "Feeling better now?"

"Yeah..." you say slowly. "Although I think the sun is starting to get to me a little bit. I might want to get out of here in a little bit."

"That's okay!" he says, rolling with the punches, not looking the slightest bit disappointed or surprised. "Yeah. Let me just call my mom and we can go back to my house, maybe, hang out a little bit."

"Uh... sure..." you say, not sure whether it would be polite to turn him down, since you have no idea what other options you have besides entrusting yourself to this over-eager grade-school Romeo. Apparently, Jared wasn't expecting you to say yes to going back to his house, because his bashful grin turns into outright beaming, and he's off to one of the lawn chairs to grab his cell phone and call his mom, leaving you momentarily to collect yourself and assess the situation before you get too deep into anything you don't want to be in.
1111112.title: Back by the swimming pool

choices: Jared comes back then, says his mom is on her way to pick you up
Approach your body. Try to talk with him and see if anything's different
11111121.content:
For that brief moment you're left by yourself, standing by the pool's shallow end, your gaze wanders while you try to distract yourself from the discomfort of feeling your half-nakedness as a prepubescent girl. You recognize most everyone who's still at the pool as people who were there when you first arrived, back when you were a guy (how long ago was that? only five minutes?). The familiar faces provokes a question in the front of your brain, which you hold onto only for another second before another sight all but answers it wholesale:

There, swimming in the middle of the pool, going about his business like nothing happened, is your old body, exactly as you left it. Same swim trunks and anything.

You open your mouth to yell something, but what do you say? Call out your own name? Yell, "Hey, you, the one who stole my body!"? That would be ridiculous! You want to say something, but after a few seconds' observation, it becomes clear to you that your old body is not acting like a thirteen-year-old girl would upon finding herself as a teenage boy, even one who facilitated the shift of her own accord. He moves like you, pulling himself up to the edge and hoisting himself onto the dry ground, going to his towel (where you left it) and drying himself off, checking his phone... There's nothing in his behavior or choices to suggest even the slightest divergence from what you yourself would be doing if nothing out of the ordinary had happened.

Which can only mean one thing. Your heart plummets. You became this little girl, and reality around you changed so nobody would be the wiser for it. Your old life would go on as if you were living it, only you weren't living it. You were here, going by the name Jenna, having to deal with the latter-half of a potentially disastrous first date, and that's all before you have any idea of where your home is, what your personal life is like, who your friends are, and so on, and so on. If you could right then (and you were of a more melancholic disposition), you would throw yourself into the pull and hold your head underwater until you drowned. The prospect of your new life is so huge and terrifying.
11111121.title: See your old body

choices: Stick with Jared a little longer; say you'll hang out with him this afternoon
111111211.content:
Jared taps you just then on your shoulder, making you whirl around with a start. He laughs at how jumpy you are, says something to the effect of, "Jeez! It's just me!", and does another facsimile of a charming boy pop star's smile, before telling you that his mom is on her way, she will be there in just a few minutes, and the two of you should move over to the parking lot to wait for her.

For a second, you're conflicted. You look back at your old body, which is currently yawning in a very unattractive way and scratching its mop head of hair. Should you leave right now, when you've just seen yourself? Shouldn't you approach your old body and try your damnedest to facilitate a reverse change, even if you don't exactly know how to? Again, you notice how utterly you, to the point of repulsion, your old body is behaving, and your heart sinks at the realization that you are the only person who notices anything amiss.

This doesn't mean, you remind yourself, that there is no hope of you ever changing back. It might take a while; you might have to wait around until another freak occurrence happens somewhere down the road, another day at the swimming pool, or somewhere else. You don't know. But for now, your best bet is to stick with Jared and understand the hand that you've been dealt.

You find your stuff on the lawn chair right next to Jared's. Pulling together everything into your butterfly-decorated handbag (you see a phone peeking out, plus lots and lots of cosmetics), and wrapping the towel over your shoulder, you slip on Jenna's flip-flops and follow Jared out of the swimming pool. Unfortunately for you, Jenna didn't come with her clothes on hand, so you'll have to weather being in just a bikini for a little while longer.

It's only a minute or two's wait before Jared's mom shows up at the curb and ushers the two of you into the backseat, saving you the idle chit-chat, which would be impossible for you to sustain anyway. Jared's mom looks like a fuller-faced version of her son. She says, "Hi!", waves at you, and asks how was your time at the swimming pool. Jared chips in, saying that you got ill near the end, but all in all, it was just the bee's knees (not his exact words). His mom nods, smiling all the while, and says she's so sorry you're feeling sick. Would you like her to take you home? You catch a glance of Jared before you give your answer. Everything in his eyes is asking you to please say no; please come home with him for the afternoon, and despite having no attachment to Jared romantically or even platonically, you feel sorry for him, for crashing what might have been a pretty okay date...
111111211.title: Riding back home with Jared

choices: Jared's mom knows the way to your house
Jared's mom asks what your address is
1111112111.content:
You feel sorry for Jared, but not sorry enough to endure another several hours of him fawning over you, speaking on your behalf, and otherwise playing the white knight to your damsel in distress.

"I think I would like to go home," you say, affecting a bit of a rasp to lend credence to the "feeling ill" claim. "I need to lie down."

"You can lie down at our house!" Jared says. "We'll put a towel on the couch, and you can lie there--"

"Now, Jared," his mom interjects, "Jenna's clearly said she wants to go home. If she's coming down with something, it's better that we drop her off at her house. You guys can hang out another time when she's feeling better."

"Okay..." Jared sulks in his corner of the backseat. You place a hand on his knee, your attempt at assuring him that everything's all right with him and Jenna. He looks over at you and manages a valiant smile.

"We'll get together another time this week," you say, not at all sure if you (or Jenna) means it or not. "Don't worry."

"Of course!" Jared says. "I had a lot of fun today."

"Me too," you say, and are startled by how demure and adorable you make those two words sound. Jared's reticent smile turns into a red-cheeked grin. Whether you're still in Jenna's body or not, she better be prepared for a Date #2 with Jared. You hope that's what she'd want.
1111112111.title: Ending the date

choices: Find a key inside your bag
Ring the doorbell--someone comes to let you in
11111121111.content:
Lucky for you, Jared's mom must have picked you up before the date, because she doesn't need to ask where Jenna's house is. She drives you directly there. It's only five minutes from the swimming pool, which puts it not too much farther away than where your old house is. You recognize the neighborhood, a forested, unincorporated part of your town where you used to live when you were much younger, and where several of your high-school friends still live. The car pulls up in front of a duplex, and for a moment, you can't remember if this is the same duplex you grew up in, or a few houses down from it.

You get out of the car, glad to escape from the over-compensating A/C that Jared's mom put on. It's a muggy, mid-August day with hardly any wind. There are clouds moving in from the west that promise rainfall sometime later in the evening. A man walks by on the sidewalk with his golden retriever. He shoots you a quick, friendly glance, and you immediately wrap your arms around yourself. You feel more uncomfortable now, standing on a residential street in nothing but a bikini. You feel immensely out of place.

Jared gets out of the car too and, like a true gentleman, escorts you to your door, his fingers brushing against your elbow. "I'll see you Monday at school," Jared says.

"Yeah," you say. "I'll see you on Monday."

You know what Jared is waiting for: a kiss, a hug, something romantic. Since his mom is over in her car, watching you, you settle with a platonic kiss on a cheek and a hand-squeeze, which you hope is enough to sate his appetite. Again, Jared's cheeks go as red as tomatoes, and he's practically skipping as he goes back to his car.

You turn around, glad to have gotten the overeager, over-fawning Jared off your back. The question is, though, how you get inside now. Jared, gratefully, led you to the door to the left apartment of the duplex, so it's safe for you to assume this is the one where you live. You might have a pair of keys in your purse. If not, you can always ring the doorbell. Is anybody home, though? Without Jared, there's a lot that you have to figure out on your own without anyone helping you. You look over your shoulder and see Jared and his mom pulling out of the driveway, but slowly enough that they can make sure you get inside safely. You wave at them, smiling, then return your gaze to the door. What to do?
11111121111.title: Being dropped off

111111211111.content:
You paw through the contents of Jenna's bag, hedging the bet that she has a key somewhere in there. You're not sure, at any rate, if Jenna's parents or any of her family are home. The parking lot is empty, and the garage (separate from the duplex) is closed. Whether there's a car inside of it, you have no way of knowing.

It only takes a few seconds, gratefully, to sift through Jenna's stuff until you stumble upon a key that's very obviously meant for the door to her house. You pull open the outer glass door and, propping it with your back, insert the key into the main doorknob and give it a twist. You hear the door unlock.

"Oh, thank God," you think, as you give one last wave to Jared and his mom and go inside.

It seems like you were right when you figured that nobody else was home. The front hallway is completely dark. Aside from the obnoxious tick of a wall clock to your right and the faint grumble of the A/C, you can't hear anything or anyone. "Hello?" you call out, waiting to see if anybody around the corner comes out to greet you. Nobody does, so you throw off Jenna's flip-flops and venture further inside, towards the kitchenette and the hallway linking all of the apartment's rooms.
111111211111.title: Find a key inside your bag

choices: Assemble an outfit quickly and put it on
Someone else peeps into your room--you weren't alone
1111112111112.content:
It's a small apartment, with a hallway linking the kitchenette to the living room at the other end. In between are doors leading to all of the other rooms, one of which must Jenna's bedroom. This is the room you are most interested in going into for the time being. Exploration can come later, but for now, you have spent more than enough time wearing a pre-teen girl's swimsuit. You need to find something that doesn't remind you so bluntly of the body you've been spirited into.

Luckily, you stumble upon Jenna's bedroom by trying the first door on the left of the hallway. You can tell it's hers because she has spelled out "J E N N A" in large sparkle letters glued to the wall above her bed. It is dusty, and messy, and you move to pull open the blinds before realizing that her room faces directly onto the driveway. If you open it up, someone outside might catch a sight of you changing. You decide to let your eyes acclimate to the shadows for now.

There's very little else to remark upon about her room. Aside from spelling her name on the wall, Jenna didn't bother with too many other personalizing touches. The bed covers are a neutral, leaning-on-the-side-of-feminine violet, and the books you see lying willy-nilly on her work desk, around her laptop, are surprising choices for a 13-year-old girl--at least you would think so. Lord of the Rings and War of the Worlds and Terry Pratchett... It makes you reconsider your image of Jenna for just a moment.

However, upon throwing open the closet, you get a stark reality check, confirming that despite her idiosyncratic literary tastes, Jenna is still an adolescent girl, and her fashion taste more than reflects that. You paw through the stuff hanging on the hangars and flip through her drawers, in search of something that's vaguely akin to your men's clothing. Even something on the tomboyish side. No luck. The jeans you find are all capris or sparkly-hemmed, shorts barely cover your thighs and look to be extra tight around the butt, and skirts, dresses, tube tops, halter-tops, v-necks, and spaghetti straps dominate the majority of the space. You can cover yourself up, but you're still going to be reminded, no matter what you wear, of the little girl you've become.
1111112111112.title: Changing in Jenna's Room

choices: Screw it, I’m just going to put clothes on over the swimsuit.
I should probably change out of it.
I should probably wash the chlorine off from the pool.
11111121111121.content:
The swimsuit at this point was relatively dry and you really didn’t want to have to strip out of it. However it was on your mind, considering.

You flopped down to Jenna’s bed as you lay in thought.

On one hand, if you stayed in this swimsuit you could just avoid having to fully change and just put clothes on over it. However, it still is a little wet so it may leave wet marks.

On the other hand, if you just tried to quickly change out of it you could have a fully dry set of clothing. It would definitely be a lot more comfortable.
11111121111121.title: Assemble an outfit quickly and put it on

choices: that maybe they could watch a movie
that maybe they could play a video game together for a bit
1111112112.content:
Feeling sorry for Jared, and thinking that perhaps following your new boyfriend is right now the best way to learn more about just who Jenna was, you simply say that you are feeling better now "It's fine, I think I feel a lot better now." you say, you notice that Jared has a look of relief on his face after hearing your words.

"Are you sure you don't want to go home?" Jared's mother asks. You nod, replying that you are sure that you are ok now. "Besides. Nothing makes feel better than being with my boyfriend" you say out loud. While your face shows a lovesick young girl, in your head you are extremely embarrassed that you actually said that. Regardless it looked like what you said cause Jared's face to both light up. Oddly enough, seeing the young boy happy made you feel good. You don't know why exactly, but you decided to scoot up a little closer to him and rest your still damp head on his shoulders. Jared's face gets a little red. His mom seems glad that you seem to be feeling better.

As Jared's mom starts the car, she 'reminds' you that you have a set of clothes in the back to change into when they arrive at his house. You tell the mother Thanks as you continue the rest your head on your boyfriend's shoulders. You don't know why you're acting all lovey dovey all of a sudden, maybe this is unconsciously an act or maybe you are doing it purely out of obligation, One thing you know however is that right now Jared is the only part of Jenna's life, your new life, that you really know anything about - vaguely as it may be - and thus right now nothing is making you feel safer than being around Jared. Soon you feel Jared place his arm behind you, seeming to be returning your little gesture by holding you in his arm. You snuggle a little closer into Jared. You mentally tell yourself that this is just an act from you to avoid suspicion even as Jared's mom comments on how adorable you two look.

In a matter of minutes, the car is parked in front of what you presumed to be Jared's house. You gather your things and the set of Jenna's clothes from the back before entering Jared's home. You had to admit that it looked like a rather nice house. Comfy, homey, but also big. Jared's mom gives you directions to the nearest bathroom to change in while Jared comments that he thought you looked nice in a bikini. You say thank you to the compliment, but in your head you know you would want nothing more than to cover your half-naked young body - though that almost meant you would have to undress....

"you can go ahead and keep your swimsuit on underneath the clothes Jenna, just in case the two of you feel like swimming again later on" the boyfriend's mom says. While it did still technically meant having to stay in the bikini, you are a little relieved that you won't have to see Jenna's nude body just yet. you are kind of surprised at the noting of going for another swim being brought up by the mother, but after looking through a bit of text messages on Jenna's phone (which was not password protected by the way) you figure that it made sense since this date was meant to be for the whole day. Once you entered the bathroom, you slipped on the set of clothes that were provided to you over the bikini. You look at yourself in the mirror. You didn't take a good look at the clothes that had been offered to you before, and you see that your are wearing a light Katy Perry t-shirt and a pair of shorts. Not too bad you thought to yourself, personally you would have preferred a plain t-shirt over a Katy Perry t-shirt but it was not the worse thing imaginable. Now that this body was covered up in clothing, you decide to take a better look at yourself beyond just the face. You had to admit that Jenna had a rather good figure for a middle school girl. and now that you think about it your brown shoulder-length hair and facial features are doing the figure a lot of justice. You are actually kind of admiring how you look. You could see why a boy like Jared would want to go out with a girl like Jenna. You could easily imagine that Jenna would have ended up being one of the more attractive girls once she hits high school. However you also had to remind yourself that this was your body for the time being and that you are trying to find a way to return to your old body.

You head out to the living room, you spot Jared who was sitting on the couch, wearing an Avengers t-shirt and still in his by-now dry swimsuit. You of course decide to would be appropriate to sit next to him. "My Mom is going out for a bit to get us something to eat for lunch" he tells you. Come to think of it, you were starting to get a little hungry, so this news pleases you. "what do you have planned in the meantime" you ask. Jared suggests...
1111112112.title: Stick with Jared a little longer; say you'l...

kiss Jared on the lips ("Jenna" starts taking control)
11111121121.content:
"well there is this movie...."

"What movie?" you ask

"Well it's called The Similars.." Jared takes up the DVD cover that was on the table in front.

"and??"

"it's a horror movie. My parents just rented it for me recently but I don't think it would be you'd be interested in it" from the tone of Jared's words, you kind of get the feeling he is playing reverse psychology - why mention the movie if he didn't think you'd - no wait, Jenna - would respond with -

"Why not?" you say, taking the dvd from Jared's hands to insert into the dvd player. You plop back on the couch right next to Jared. You were never all that into horror movies, namely because you never felt scared with any of them that you watched, but you didn't see the harm in watching this particular one. This was simply to pass the time for until you found a way to get your body back; for now you would play the role of this young girl who just happened to have a boyfriend.

At first the movie seemed as you would expect from every other horror film you had ever saw, with one particular exception - "how old is this movie?"

"It's actually not that old. They just chose to make the movie black and white for some reason" Jared explains - "Also I didn't realize that this was in spanish with subtitles"

"It's fine. I don't mind having to read a little" you say

You followed along with the movie - which you had to admit was very very strange. And it only got stranger and stranger as it went along, unsettling you would say. You didn't like where things were going with the characters in the movie, and you actually started to worry that maybe it wasn't just a movie. There was then one scene, a rather disturbing scene, that made you jump and -
"AAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!" all of a sudden you found yourself clinging and burying into Jared's arm.

"Wow, it's ok. I'm here" Jared tells you, freeing up his arm so that he could wrap it around you.

"Sorry, stuff like this doesn't usually scare me" you whimper.

"Don't worry, I gotcha"

"Thank you" you don't realize what you had just said until afterwards. "Oh god, why am I acting like this?" you think to yourself. Now that you think about it, you were acting very lovey dovery towards your boyfriend - wait no Jared - well of course he is Jared and he is your boyfr - "Shit. Could it be that the longer I stay in this body the more I become like this Jenna?" you wonder. Now this was scary. It was bad enough that you were stuck in the body of a young girl, but now there was the possibility that you were mentally becoming this young girl. You were lost in these thoughts until you realized that the credits for the movie were rolling. You look up at Jared's face, he seemed concerned about you, perhaps now wondering if maybe suggesting the movie was a mistake. Before Jared could say anything you -
11111121121.title: that maybe they could watch a movie

choices: Head home with your new mother
Ask if you can have a sleepover with Jared instead
111111211212.content:
To your horror however, your new body suddenly kisses Jared! On the lips!

Jared, being an adolescent boy, of course kisses back.

You are screaming in your head, trying to stop yourself, but it was as though this body was on autopilot. There was nothing you could do to help yourself as you continue to kiss Jared.

After the kiss, you are utterly mortified inside. On the outside however, you are smiling gleefully from the kiss. "... that was my first kiss..." you say.

"Mine too babe" Jared replies.

Your new body giggles and blushes, even though inside you are broken.

"WTF DID I JUST DO?!?!?!" you thought, "and why am I acting all gleefully?" Was this new body really starting to take control? Were you losing yourself? Were you really turning into Jenna?

You open your mouth "want another one?" Wait no, that was not what you had meant to say. But alas you were left helpless as this body you were trapped inside kisses the adolescent boy once again.

"Home"

Upon hearing the voice of your boyfriend's mother, the two of you freeze. And with that, you seem to regain control over yourself. Thank god!

"Sorry I took so long, the store was busier then usual. What did y'all do while I was gone?"

"Jj.. just watched some tv Mom" Jared replies. His face was red, as was your's.

"Well lunch is ready" Jared's mom lifted up sandwich stuff

"I was getting hungry too" you say, your own words leaving your mouth again! As you got up, you notice Jared look at you - silently pleading for another quick kiss.

You were lucky to have regained control and you didn't feel like kissing a boy who was technically younger than you - even if you were now his age physically. However you didn't want to raise suspicion so you mustered up all the courage you could - you smile and kiss your boyfriend on the cheek. He seemed satisfied with this.

After lunch, Jared grabs hold of your hand and leads you to his room. His mother makes sure to tell y'all to "leave the door open".

You look around the bedroom. Jared seemed like a typical middle school boy from the looks of his room, into the typical stuff like the MCU and LOTR. You bump into something on the floor. You lift it up, but Jared doesn't seem to want you to look.

"Ah that's noth-"

"Awwwwww. You look so cute" you say in a cutesy voice, turning the photo book over to reva a photo of a 3 year old Jared making a mess with a cake. Great, Jenna was taking control again it seemed...

"That's... private..." Jared swipes the book, hiding it away. You compose yourself as Jared hastily hides the photo book.

Having been a guy before, you know what it's like to be in Jared's position. Coming up from behind him, you whisper into his year "let me tell you a little secret". Jared stops to listen as you lean onto him. "Girls like it when boys let their guard down".

"Oh, really?" He asks curiously

You nod. You were kinda pulling shit out of your ass with that one, but at least it was you talking an not Jenna...

Something catches your attention. "Is that a GameCube?" You point at an old console

"It was my Dad's. He let me have it."

"I wanna try it out!" You say, sitting yourself down on the floor.

"Sure thing babe" Jared replies as he turns the console on. The two of you play some Smash bros melee, playfullg trash talking eachother as you two switch between kicking the other's ass. You can't help but feel very close to Jared right now - and that wasn't just the Jenna speaking. You think that if you two had been brothers, or maybe even friends, you would have gotten along very well.

However right now you were a girl, and he was your boyfriend. And every second of bonding between you and Jared is a second where Jenna could take control over you.

But now that you think about it, this whole experience, along with Jared being your boyfriend, has made you question your own sexuality anyway...

Soon after a few rounds, Jared's mom comes in to tell you that your mom, or rather Jenna's Mom, was here to pick you up. Jared helps you on your feet before kissing you again while his Mom wasn't looking. You didn't know if this was Jenna or you actinf, but all you knew was that you didn't hesitate during the kiss.

Downstairs, you get the first glimpse of your apparent mother. Soon you would probably be meeting your apparent family. You were a little worried about meeting Jenna's family, mainly cause you still had no idea who Jenna was. If your apparant family noticed you acting strange, or out of character for Jenna, they would start asking questions.

You look back at Jared. You feel safer around him than you do your "mother".

"So how'd it go?" Your "mom" asks

"Oh you know exactly what I mean young lady?" She is smirking at you "you didn't think I didn't spot you two K-I-S"

"first kiss?"
